column4: Sorry to be annoying and ask again, but how well does Ubuntu run on ARM?
So I'd be picking the specs
Linux is great, but beating Windows is going to take awhile
your wrong, the majority of people want a browser, office, that's it. For the majority of people Ubuntu is better for 2 reasons, 1 it's faster at achieving those goals, 2 it's virus free.
You're totally right, but people are still not changing over
yea, they don't need to, just like the netbook replaced the laptop, the phone will replace the netbook.
no they arn't, Ubuntu is free? o.O
If you're going to sell a device with Ubuntu pre-installed, you gotta pay
incorrect. If your going to sell a device, modify Ubuntu, and then still use the Ubuntu brand name, you have to pay.
really?  I thought Dell had to pay for Ubuntu...
if you sell a device with unmodified  Ubuntu installed, there are no licensing fees.
yes, that's because they heavily modify it.
if they just used a Ubuntu OEM install there would be no licensing fee required
they wanted to use their own repositories and ship with preinstalled uglyness like flash player
Why don't they name it CrapDellu?
because they wanted it to be Ubuntu so people would buy it xD
